title: 5 Quick Ways to Select and Highlight Multiple Files or Folders

steps.title: Hold Ctrl to select non-consecutive files.
steps.content: Hold Ctrl to select non-consecutive files. This means files that are not next to each other. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Click one file. Hold down Ctrl . Click another file. Repeat for all files. Release Ctrl when finished.

steps.title: Hold ⇧ Shift to select consecutive files.
steps.content: Hold ⇧ Shift to select consecutive files. This means files that are next to each other. Click the first file of the selection. Hold down Shift . Click the last file of the selection. Release Shift .

steps.title: Use your mouse to select files.
steps.content: Use your mouse to select files. Drag your cursor from one end of the selection to the opposite end. This will highlight all files in the square-shaped selection. Once selected, you can move the files, copy them elsewhere, or delete them .

steps.title: Use a keyboard shortcut to select all.
steps.content: Use a keyboard shortcut to select all. Press Ctrl + A to select all files in a destination.

steps.title: Hold ⌘ Cmd to select non-consecutive files.
steps.content: Hold ⌘ Cmd to select non-consecutive files. This means files that are not next to each other. Click one file. Hold down Cmd . Click another file. Repeat for all files. Release Cmd when finished.

steps.title: Hold ⇧ Shift to select consecutive files.
steps.content: Hold ⇧ Shift to select consecutive files. This means files that are next to each other. Click the first file of the selection. Hold down Shift . Click the last file of the selection. Release Shift .

steps.title: Use your mouse to select files.
steps.content: Use your mouse to select files. Drag your cursor from one end of the selection to the opposite end. This will highlight all files in the square-shaped selection.

steps.title: Use a keyboard shortcut to select all.
steps.content: Use a keyboard shortcut to select all. Press Cmd + A to select all files in a destination.

steps.title: Open the Files app.
steps.content: Open the Files app. This is where files are saved onto your Android device.

steps.title: Navigate to the files you want to select.
steps.content: Navigate to the files you want to select. Tap ☰ in the top-left corner to navigate your folders.

steps.title: Tap and hold a file.
steps.content: Tap and hold a file. This will select the file and allow you to select more.

steps.title: Tap the rest of the files.
steps.content: Tap the rest of the files. They will be highlighted in blue. You can also hold your finger and scroll downwards to select multiple files. You can tap the share icon to edit the files or send them elsewhere.

steps.title: Open the Files app.
steps.content: Open the Files app. This is where files are saved onto your iPhone or iPad device.

steps.title: Navigate to the files you want to select.
steps.content: Navigate to the files you want to select. Tap Browse at the bottom-right corner to browse all folders.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Select.
steps.content: Tap Select . You can find this at the top of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap the files you want to select.
steps.content: Tap the files you want to select. You'll see a checkmark in the middle of each file selected. Alternatively, tap Select All in the top-left corner to select all files. Once selected, tap the Share icon in the bottom-left corner to copy the files, print them , or upload them elsewhere.

steps.title: Open Google Drive.
steps.content: Open Google Drive. You can use Google Drive in a web browser at https://drive.google.com/ or the mobile app for iOS and Android. If you aren't already logged into your Google account , do so now.

steps.title: Click a file.
steps.content: Click a file. It should be highlighted in blue. On mobile, tap and hold a file.

steps.title: Hold Ctrl or ⌘ Cmd and click more files.
steps.content: Hold Ctrl or ⌘ Cmd and click more files. On mobile, tap more files. You can tap ••• (mobile) or use the toolbar at the top (desktop) to move or edit the selected files.
